  • Element
com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.layout

Annotation Type TAccordion


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value=FIELD)
public @interface TAccordion
     Build a Accordion.
 
 Example: 
 
  @TAccordion(panes = {@TTitledPane(text = "Group Fields", fields={"optionsField", "passField", "integerField"})})
  @TLabel(text="Choose a book:", control=@TControl(prefWidth=500))
  @TVerticalRadioGroup(spacing=5, required=true, alignment= Pos.CENTER_LEFT
          ,radioButtons={
          @TRadioButtonField(userData="A", text="The Java Programming Language"),
          @TRadioButtonField(userData="B", text="The Java Language Specification")
  })
  private SimpleStringProperty optionsField;
  
  @TLabel(text="Password:", control=@TControl(prefWidth=500))
  @TPasswordField(required=true, maxLength=6)
  private SimpleStringProperty passField;
                
  @TLabel(text="Number field", control=@TControl(prefWidth=500))
  @TIntegerField(zeroValidation=TZeroValidation.MORE_THAN_ZERO, control=@TControl(tooltip="Max value: "+Integer.MAX_VALUE))
  private SimpleIntegerProperty integerField;
 
 Oracle documentation:
 
 An accordion is a group of TitlePanes. Only one TitledPane can be opened at a time.

 The TitledPane content in an accordion can be any Node such as UI controls or groups of nodes added to a layout container.
 
 It is not recommended to set the MinHeight, PrefHeight, or MaxHeight for this control. 
 Unexpected behavior will occur because the Accordion's height changes when a TitledPane is opened or closed.
 
 Accordion sets focusTraversable to false.
    Author:
    Davis Gordon
    See Also:
    TTitledPane

      • expandedPane

        public abstract java.lang.String expandedPane
         Accordion Class
 
  The expanded TitledPane that is currently visible. While it is technically possible to 
  set the expanded pane to a value that is not in getPanes(), doing so will be treated by 
  the skin as if expandedPane is null. If a pane is set as the expanded pane, and is 
  subsequently removed from getPanes(), then expanded pane will be set to null, if possible. 
  (This will not be possible if you have manually bound the expanded pane to some value, for example).
        Default:
        ""

      • mode

        public abstract TViewMode[] mode
         Specifies the view mode to use this compent.
 
 Set to TMode.READER will build this component only when the user set the view to Reader mode.
 
 Default value:
 {TMode.EDIT, TMode.READER}
        Default:
        {com.tedros.fxapi.domain.TViewMode.EDIT, com.tedros.fxapi.domain.TViewMode.READER}
